meanings.definition: To organize, store, and retrieve data in a database.
meanings.sent1: I databased all the information from the survey into our system.
meanings.sent2: She databased the client details for quick reference.
meanings.sent3: The computer databased the files faster than I could blink.
meanings.sent4: His mind databased memories like a well-organized library.
meanings.sent5: Databasing the records made the search process efficient.

meanings.definition: A collection of data organized in a structured format for easy access and manipulation.
meanings.sent1: The databased contained all the sales figures for the year.
meanings.sent2: We referred to the databased to analyze the trends.
meanings.sent3: The databased sat quietly on the server, waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent4: Her brain was like a databased of recipes, always ready to provide information.
meanings.sent5: The databased was a treasure trove of valuable information.
